column2: KENTUCKY DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 2. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column6: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 3. In a vehicle equipped with air bags a child under 12 years old should be placed:
column8: In either the front or back seat.

column2: 4. What does BAC stand for?

6. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 7. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column8: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 8. Warning signs normally are:
9. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
10. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 11. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column6: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.
column8: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.

column2: 12. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 13. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
14. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column6: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column8: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 15. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change from green to red.

18. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
19. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column8: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 20. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 21. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 22. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column4: move to the lane on their left.
column6: move to the lane on their right.

column2: 23. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
24. A flashing red light means:
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 25. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column6: The other answers are both correct.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.

column2: 26. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
27. ABS is the acronym for:
28. This road sign means:
column4: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon
column8: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon

column2: 29. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
30. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 31. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 33. This sign means:
column4: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column8: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 34. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: place their foot on the accelerator.
column6: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: Do not pass on the left.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
37. This sign indicates:
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 38. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
40. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column6: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column8: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.
